sentence.Network_en: Sensing she was on shaky ground, Marie changed the subject.
sentence.Network_cn: 感到自己的观点站不住脚，玛丽于是换了个话题。

sentence.Network_en: The Labor Department figures underscore the shaky state of the economic recovery.
sentence.Network_cn: 劳工部的数据进一步印证了经济复苏状况的不稳定。

sentence.Network_en: His speech was difficult to understand, his signature shaky and unrecognizable.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的演说很难听懂，他的签名颤颤巍巍地无法识别。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 大学英语精读单词表(第三册) - 豆丁网 ... wreckage n. 残骸 shaky a. 摇晃的 carry-over n. 剩余物.
十八级词汇 - 豆丁网 ... setting n. 安装， 调整； 环境 shaky a. 震动的, 摇晃的, 动摇的 shambles n. 混乱之处， 凌乱的地点.
计算机专业英语词汇 ... stable adj 稳定的 shaky adj 摇动的 registry n 登记.
英语词汇讲义：广义的谐音助记术_英语吧_百度贴吧 ... shiver 颤抖, shaky 颤抖的, ship 船.

list.abs: The perils of dealing with shaky regimes cut both ways ., 冒险与不稳定的政权打交道有利有弊.
you can't build the argument on very shaky premises .你不能把论点建立在不可靠的前提下。
you can't build the argument on very shaky premises .你不能把论点建立在不可靠的前提下。
Government loans have been the salvation of several shaky companies ., 政府的贷款拯救了几个要破产的公司.
but it left a shaky feeling .但是它留下令人震撼的感觉。

entry.tran: 不稳固的;不牢靠的;不会长久的;不会成功的
entry.def: If you describe a situation as shaky, you mean that it is weak or unstable, and seems unlikely to last long or be successful.

example.ex: A shaky ceasefire is holding after three days of fighting between rival groups...
example.tran: 敌对武装团伙在经过3天的交战后暂时停火。

example.ex: I'm afraid that this school year is off to a shaky start...
example.tran: 恐怕这学年一开学就不顺。

entry.def: If your body or your voice is shaky, you cannot control it properly and it shakes, for example because you are ill or nervous.

example.ex: We have all had a shaky hand and a dry mouth before speaking in public...
example.tran: 当众发言前，我们全都手脚发抖，嘴巴发干。

example.ex: Even small operations can leave you feeling a bit shaky...
example.tran: 即使是小手术也会让你有点战战兢兢。

means.word_mean: 1. inclined to shake as from weakness or defect;

sentences.sentence: "the bridge still stands though one of the arches is wonky"

means.word_mean: 2. vibrating slightly and irregularly; as e.g. with fear or cold or like the leaves of an aspen in a breeze;

sentences.sentence: "sparkling light from the shivering crystals of the chandelier"

auth_sentence.content: The future looked shaky for Moffett Towers last year.
auth_sentence.res_content: The future looked shaky for Moffett Towers last year.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The future looked shaky for Moffett Towers last year.

auth_sentence.content: His hands were too shaky to wield the brush.
auth_sentence.res_content: His hands were too shaky to wield the brush.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His hands were too shaky to wield the brush.

auth_sentence.content: Beyond the Web, the greeting-card market is shaky.
auth_sentence.res_content: Beyond the Web, the greeting-card market is shaky.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Beyond the Web, the greeting-card market is shaky.

Sentence.sentence: Some critics blame affirmative action – students admitted with lower test scores and grades from shaky high schools often struggle at elite schools.

sentences.en: The experience had left him rather shaky.
sentences.cn: 这次经历使得他胆战心惊。

sentences.en: Her voice was low and shaky with emotion.
sentences.cn: 她的声音低沉，因激动而有些颤抖。

means.word_mean: 不坚定的,不稳定的,不可靠的

sentences.en: The company’s finances are looking a bit shaky.
sentences.cn: 这个公司的财政情况看来有点不稳定。

sentences.en: The peace treaty rests on shaky foundations.
sentences.cn: 这项和平条约建于不稳固的基础上。
